page.title: 04STUDLAND AMENITIES
page.content: A group of children visited houses in the village and questioned occupants as to their feelings about local conditions and issues.Most were long established residents who valued the village for its beauty, peace and the local life.Few had serious complaints about the place.A few wished for fewer tourists, one for a butcher's shop, one for better street lighting and one for tidier streets.Most folk used private cars for transport,but the bus services are also used by many. Shopping loyalty is divided between local shops, delivery vans and the large urban Supermarkets in Poole and Bournemouth. Below is a list of local amenities: {Gardening Club, W.I.,Youth Club, {Mother's Union,Ferkins, Church Men's {Club, Play Group,Over 60's,Travelling {Library,Methodist's Dancing Group. }
